title: Best of the February Bookshelf: Our Reviewers’ Picks
sub_head: ‘No One Is Talking About This,’ ‘Think Again,’ ‘Dostoevsky in Love’—and more of the best reads from this month.
body:
A selection of 12 of the month’s most noteworthy books, as discussed by The Wall Street Journal’s reviewers.
By Walter Mosley | Mulholland
Mr. Mosley’s enduringly popular hero, the black private eye Easy Rawlins, returns in a fresh mystery that, as reviewer Tom Nolan notes, ought to find the detective in secure middle age: The fruits of success have given Easy a life that allows him to “read to his mind’s content and cultivate his rooftop rose garden.” But “hard characters and dark deeds” are still out there, as in the case of a troubled Vietnam veteran who may have committed a murder, and “the more Easy looks into things . . . the murkier they seem.”
Read the review
By Erika Fatland | Pegasus
